conclusion: Determine the time t1 it takes for the wooden rod to pass through the upper end A of the cylinder.
The wooden rod is initially at rest and falls freely under gravity.
The rod needs to fall a distance of 25 m to reach the top of the cylinder.
The equation for the distance fallen by an object under constant acceleration due to gravity is s = (1/2) g t^2.
Substituting values into the equation: 25 = (1/2) * 10 * t^2, leading to t^2 = 5.
Solving for t gives t = sqrt(5) ≈ 2.236 s.
The time it takes for the rod to reach the top of the cylinder is approximately 2.236 s.
The rod needs to travel an additional 10 m to completely pass through the cylinder.
Using the same kinematic equation s = (1/2) g t^2 for the cylinder.
Substituting values into the equation: 10 = (1/2) * 10 * t^2, leading to t^2 = 2.
Solving for t gives t = sqrt(2) ≈ 1.414 s.
The time it takes for the rod to pass through the cylinder is approximately 1.414 s.
The total time t1 is the sum of the time to reach the top of the cylinder and the time to pass through the cylinder: t1 = 2.236 + 1.414 = 3.65 s.
The time t1 it takes for the wooden rod to pass through the upper end A of the cylinder is 3.65 s.
